attributes.action: Reduce Fees on Degrees that lead to Jobs in Public Services (Government Jobs)
attributes.background: Healthcare? Funded. Scientists? We cover them. Why is more not being done with the training for these roles? If a student agrees to terms where they're guaranteed a GVT job after completing their course, then fees for this student should either be scrapped entirely, or considerably discounted.
attributes.additional_details: How it would work: On beginning a degree such as medicine, physics, or one in teaching, you alert the government that upon the course's conclusion, you are happy to accept a predetermined government/public-services role (e.g. surgeon/MI5 agent/psychiatrist/physicist) with employment-terms as defined by the GVT. If you leave the course or job-role before a certain amount of time, then the fees will be charged like any other degree (as you won't have used it for the GVT's intended purpose).

attributes.action: Enforcement of election laws & removal of MPs found to be breaking the law
attributes.background:
MPs found guilty of breaking election rules (inc. how they declared costs) should be:
- expelled from the Commons & barred from by-election
also:
- elections should be nullified & a new by-election held
- others found implicated breaking election law should face full force of the law
attributes.additional_details:
Additionally, if there are several instances of MPs being disqualified, bills passed due the deciding votes of disqualified MPs should be brought before the House again after the by-elections have returned legitimately elected Members of Parliament. 
Current Investigations
http://www.markpack.org.uk/139895/conservative-mps-election-expenses-investigation-police/

attributes.action: Require a referendum before any decision on the privatisation of public services
attributes.background: In recent times the Post Office has been sold to private ownership and it would seem that the NHS is being sold in small increments currently. All of this happens without the confirmation of the UK voting population. A referendum would, at the least, raise a large amount of awareness to the public.

attributes.action: Reward home working - provide direct tax relief to both employees and employers
attributes.background: Home working is the magic bullet that could solve numerous problems in one. Though it is a current reality for many, home working must be incentivised to drive participation and adoption.
attributes.additional_details:
Home working delivers:

- enormous reduction in individual and institutional carbon footprint
- Increased time employees have with families, loved ones and friends
- eliminates financial costs of commuting to Reduces traffic on UK's roads by up to 40-50%
- Ditto for public transport

I propose:

- direct monthly tax break for employees, pro rata'd by number of non-commuting days (reportedly employer)
- tax break for companies to drive adoption
- subsidisation of setup costs

attributes.action: 10k p.a higher earner's income transfer among couples with children
attributes.background: For married couple with children, Introduce a system where the higher earner can transfer up to £10k to low earning spouse to realize tax savings which can help with child care costs. E.g. If £50k earner in the 40% tax band could transfer £10k to spouse earning £15k to reduce tax on the transferred.

attributes.action: If you pay the TV licence fee you should be able to watch UK TV abroad.
attributes.background: In the UK we pay a licence fee to watch TV, but when you go abroad you cannot watch any UK TV on apps like Iplayer, demand 5 etc.
attributes.additional_details: We are now told that to be able to watch BBC Iplayer we will need to pay the license fee. Therefore on that basis we should be able to watch any UK TV content whilst travelling abroad.

attributes.action: Please Reform The Year 6 SATs
attributes.background:
Last night my son was violently sick, this wasn't from illness, but from the stress of the SATs.
I've seen a massive change in his usual behaviour regardless of my comfort and reassurance. I would like the testing to be spread out over the last term, not crammed into one week.
attributes.additional_details:
The SATs Timetable
Monday 9 May 2016-Key stage 2 English reading test, reading booklet and associated answer booklet.
Tuesday 10 2016- Key stage 2 English grammar, punctuation and spelling test, Paper 1, short answer questions. Key stage 2 English grammar, punctuation and spelling test, Paper 2, spelling.
Wednesday 11 May 2016-Key stage 2 mathematics, Paper 1 arithmetic test. Key stage 2 mathematics, Paper 2 reasoning.
Thursday 12 May 2016	Key stage 2 mathematics, Paper 3, reasoning

attributes.action: Make it illegal for companies not to plant as many trees as they destroy.
attributes.background: Trees are disappearing at an unsustainable rate. It is time to act. Many companies plant more trees than they use already, but to make any real change it must be made illegal for them not to do so.

attributes.action: Introduce new legislation to ban sexist adverts.
attributes.background:
There is currently a double standard in adverts for what is and isn't considered sexist for men and women.

In many adverts men are mocked, ridiculed, sexualized/objectified in ways that would be completely unacceptable if the sexes were reversed.

Let's have some equality.
attributes.additional_details:
See example adverts: http://sexistads.org/#ads

There is a repeated message in adverts that men are stupid, inferior, sex objects and that their role is purely to serve women. This stereotype is sexist and damaging young men and boys.

These adverts would be completely unacceptable if the sexes were reversed. What's good for the goose is good for the gander.

We propose: a "would this be offensive if we changed the ['sex', 'race', 'age', 'religion']?" test to be applied to all adverts.

attributes.action: Start publishing summaries of protest messages written on voting papers
attributes.background: Writing a message on a ballot paper is seen by many as a legitimate means to protest or to air a view. Such messages are written as part of the democratic process with the intention of being read and therefore should be published after elections as a matter of course.

attributes.action: Make horse ownership illegal
attributes.background: Horse ownership is slavery: a cruel, unnecessary practice that puts each and every horse through unimaginable horrors and humiliation. Horses were born to roam free on wild, open fields, but they have been captured and broken in for generations, with no reprieve. Help us end this monstrous cruelty!
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.peta.org/about-peta/faq/how-does-peta-feel-about-horseback-riding/

http://www.peta.org/issues/animals-in-entertainment/animals-used-entertainment-factsheets/charreada-bone-breaking-cruelty/

attributes.action: Make it illegal for job advertisements to omit salary and benefits.
attributes.background:
The gender pay gap is a big, and unnecessary, issue  

In the interest of consistency, equality and fairness making it mandatory to enumerate salary and benefits on any job advertisement   would make it clear internally and externally that a company is committed to transparency.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.theguardian.com/money/2016/mar/07/gender-pay-gap-uk-women-earn-300000-less-men-lifetime

http://www.ons.gov.uk/employmentandlabourmarket/peopleinwork/earningsandworkinghours/bulletins/annualsurveyofhoursandearnings/2015provisionalresults#main-points

Even if this 

http://uk.businessinsider.com/statistics-on-the-gender-pay-gap-for-men-and-women-2016-3

is substantially correct publishing salaries on adverts is hardly going to hinder gender equality.

attributes.action: New Members of Parliament shall be elected by British citizens living overseas.
attributes.background: Millions of British citizens who live and work outside the country are unable to vote in national elections and hence are deprived of representation in parliament. New Members of Parliament shall be elected by, and will represent, these citizens.
attributes.additional_details: The right to vote and be represented in parliament is a fundamental privilege of citizenship, not of residency. Millions of lifelong citizens of Britain only are currently barred from voting in national elections even while individuals with dual citizenship and new citizens may vote. This anomaly shall be remedied by welcoming new Members of Parliament elected solely by those British citizens living overseas who are unable to vote in a geographic constituency.

attributes.action: Spend more money on public services rather than spending it on the military.
attributes.background: 2% of our GDP is spent on our military, a statistic from 2014, that figure has gone done by 0.3% over the last 4 years but our GDP has been rising, meaning more is spent on the military, but public services like the NHS and the police force spending is decreasing.We want more money spent on services
attributes.additional_details: whilst our military spending rises due to our warmongering and being a puppet state to america our public services are getting no extra funding. for the last couple of years the government said that they will fix the NHS and increase the police force but they have done they have done is decrease the spending. The north welsh armed police have to help Cheshire to cut costs because they don't get enough funding. Only 3000 police were at hand to stop the riot in London 2011,an entire city to cover.

attributes.action: Make may 2nd a national holiday to mark Leicester city's title win
attributes.background: On the 2014/15 season Leicester just missed relegation, on the 2015/16 won the premier league with odds of 5000/1. As one of the greatest sporting shocks of modern football, may 2nd should be made a holiday

attributes.action: Prevent tractors from using main roads during rush hour.
attributes.background: Rush hour is already a stressful part of the day, with the inclusion of tractors, causing long tail backs (and not pulling over), not being able to overtake because of the time of day this is making commutes longer and workers late.

attributes.action: Confirm that there are no current or future plans to privatise the NHS
attributes.background: With the increasing persistent demand that Junior Doctors adopt a new contract that is not viable and will endanger patients health and the slow privatisation of some parts of the NHS. The government need to publically and on formal record confirm they have no intention to fully privatise the NHS.
attributes.additional_details: Some aspects of the ambulance service have been privatised as have some 'back office' functions. This latest contract being imposed on doctors is another way of taking control and imposing change on an already struggling NHS service. In order to show the governments committed to supporting and ensuring the continuation of the NHS they need to confirm what to date they have failed to do. That the NHS is a vital public service that WILL NOT ever be privatised but will instead be protected against it.

attributes.action: Remove Ntokozo Qwabe, the Oxford student.
attributes.background: Remove Ntokozo Qwabe, the Oxford student who was responsible for trying to remove Cecil Rhodes statue, from the UK. Remove his visa and return him for being a racist boasting about how he mistreated a white waitress and refused to tip because she was white.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.groundup.org.za/article/rhodes-must-fall-leader-waiter-we-will-give-tip-when-return-land/

http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-3566362/Oxford-student-Rhodes-Fall-campaign-boasts-refused-tip-waitress-white-left-floods-tears.html#comments

attributes.action: Ban Marine Le Pen from entering the UK
attributes.background: Marine Le Pen is planning to visit the UK in May or June. We do not want her fascist and divisive views here. She has to be barred from entering the UK. Please sign this petition to tell the Home Secretary Theresa May we do not want Marine Le Pen in the UK

attributes.action: Allow everyone working (self employed or employed) to claim travel expenses.
attributes.background: Anyone employed and paying tax shoud be able to claim any expenses incurred against any tax payable including travel expenses.
attributes.additional_details: Self employed people and business owners are able to claim expenses against any tax they may owe. It is unfair that the lower paid can not claim travel expenses when travel to and from work can be a large expense for them.

attributes.action:
Replace London Prisons Before 
Their Closure Date, 
We Need Prisons In London.
attributes.background:
Many inmates do not get regular visits from family or friends,
as people can not afford to travel across the country to
see loved ones who are serving a sentence.
To take away a prisoners liberty is punishment enough,
without depriving them of regular contact with family.

attributes.action: Remove the indirect sex discrimination from the new junior doctors contract.
attributes.background: Deem the technically lawful but blatant sex discrimination in the equality impact assessment done on the new contract for junior doctors in England unworthy.  Require the government to address the adverse impact of the nodal pay model on those working part-time under the new contract.
attributes.additional_details:
see 
https://www.gov.uk/government/uploads/system/uploads/attachment_data/file/512696/jd-eia.pdf


"80. Insofar as the nodal pay model may disadvantage women working part-time (as compared with the hypothetical position under the existing contract) we consider 
25 that this is consistent with the principle of pay based on level of responsibility that 
underpins the new contract. Any indirect adverse effect which may occur is a proportionate means of achieving a legitimate aim." 

Note: The careful use of the term "indirect" to avoid falling foul of technical illegality, the wording falls foul of the spirit of the legislation but not the form.

attributes.action: Primary Care and Walk-in Centres open for 24 hours to tackle nhs waiting times
attributes.background: If Primary Care centres and Walk-in centres worked in a similar way to A&E departments this would cut the waiting times for appointments, help more people in need, take the strain off A&E departments and potentially create more jobs for GPs and nurses nationwide.

attributes.action: Name under age murderers or serious offenders and sentence them as adults
attributes.background: Regardless of age, if you are capable of and willing to take or seriously damage/alter another's life, you should be considered old enough to be named, and charged as an adult. A child does not make these decisions, we have to stop protecting them and show them they can't just get away with it again

attributes.action: Reduce the annual UK Foreign Aid budget from its present level.
attributes.background: The present aid budget is totally inappropriate to the current financial circumstances of the UK. Moreover the aid budget has also proved to be wasteful and ineffectively managed and distributed.

attributes.action: Stop the Government's proposed changes to the Skipton Fund
attributes.background: Prior to July 1992, many people were infected with Hepatitis C due to NHS treatment with infected blood, or before 1987 for blood clotting disorders. Many died and many more are suffering with the pain and misery of this disease, unable to work, adding financial difficulties to their stress.
attributes.additional_details:
The Skipton Fund was set up to provide ex gratia payments to affected patients.

The Government is now consulting on plans to cut these payments.

We must not let this happen; they deserve all the support they are entitled to.

Please sign this petition and pass it on to as many people as possible.

attributes.action: Compulsory prison terms for all drivers speeding to evade a police pursuit
attributes.background: I am horrified by the number of drivers that speed recklessly, particularly through residential areas, threatening the lives of pedestrians and other road users, in order to evade pursuing police. When eventually caught, they rarely receive a custodial sentence, despite posing such a danger to life.

attributes.action: Make the public aware of the dangers of Ibuprofen in children with Chickenpox
attributes.background: A UK newspaper reported a case of parents being advised to taken a brand of medication containing Ibuprofen for chickenpox, causing severe complications (septicemia) Patient UK,NHS Choices,NICE warns of a potential reaction during chickenpox,public need to be aware & medications need to highlight it
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.express.co.uk/news/uk/659299/Nurofen-chickenpox-ibuprofen-septicaemia-parents-danger-medicine-skin-rash

http://www.nhs.uk/Conditions/Chickenpox/Pages/Treatment.aspx

http://cks.nice.org.uk/chickenpox#!prescribinginfosub:1

http://patient.info/health/chickenpox-in-children-under-12

attributes.action: Support equal access to education for children in Africa.
attributes.background: Reports suggest that 70 million children get no education across the world and those living in north-eastern Africa are least likely to go to school. By raising awareness on the issue on a national scale we can help those children who are disadvantaged by supporting their journey through education.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.theguardian.com/education/2010/sep/20/70m-get-no-education

An education would lead to a good career, build character and construct the foundations for a strong nation, which is further suggested by humanitarian Nelson Mandela; “Education is the most powerful weapon which you can use to change the world.” If you teach a child how to read and write, it will allow them to be empowered with knowledge which will be crucial to give them a better future and the impacts to be sustained.

attributes.action: More research into Medullary Sponge Kidney disease (MSK)
attributes.background: I am in the MSK patients I live with daily pain upon researching this illness there is not much research we have chronic pain and many other daily problems there isn't many doctors that understand this illness and living with this is a nightmare you get labelled as drug users this is wrong
attributes.additional_details: I found a group on Facebook this seems to be a worldwide problem not many doctors understand this disease and I think there should be more research into what could help us live a normal life it doesn't just affect those patients it affects everyone around us and I think there should be more research into what could help us live a normal life we shouldn't have to endor there ignorance towards this illness please can we have the help we need to live a half normal life

attributes.action: Offer the Tata steel business to the steel unions and workers.
attributes.background: instead of nationalising tata steel, get the steel unions and workers to buy it as a real cooperative and do not saddle the taxpayer with more white elephants. If they think it is a going concern then they can put their own money up for once.

attributes.action: Change the process through which referendums are held
attributes.background: The entire electorate to be given an automatic vote in favour of the status quo. Only those wishing to change the status quo should be required to register an alternative vote.
attributes.additional_details: In this way if 51% + of the electorate is motivated to get out and vote a clear mandate for change is demonstrated. Anything else is undemocratic and simply counts those motivated to actively vote, even when they didn't ask for any change to begin with. Only those opposed to majority rule would be against this.

attributes.action: Allowing voluntary donations for NHS treatment, which are free at point of use.
attributes.background: I'm proud of our NHS and I would like to ensure we maintain a free at point of use NHS for future generations. Allowing voluntary contributions would help to secure vital NHS services. No one would be obliged or pressured to make these contributions, they would be on a strictly voluntary basis only.

attributes.action: Consider a vote of no confidence in Nicky Morgan, Education Secretary
attributes.background: Nicky Morgan has recently introduced plans for every school in England to become an academy. State schools are regulated by parents and local authorities, wheras academies set their own curriculum, staff conditions and are run by a private sponsor.

attributes.action: Move the clock change day to a Thursday.
attributes.background: Move the clock change day to a Thursday so people can still have a lie in and enjoy their weekend as nobody is really bothered about losing an hours sleep before a Friday.

attributes.action: Force news outlets to place more prominent apologies in publications.
attributes.background: Many publications make errors with what they print. Mistakes are fine, but apologies to those affected are often hidden or obscured from the publication's readers. This should be changed as many readers will never see the apology which causes unfair complications for those implicated by the mistake
attributes.additional_details:
Publications such as The Sun and The Mirror hide their corrections in a separate part of their website. See the Imgur link below:

http://imgur.com/a/uD6Bd

But plenty of other publications do the same thing. Apologies should be prominently placed on the homepage of every publication. This will reduce the number of errors publications make as their mistakes will be more easily noticed and scrutinized much more closely.

attributes.action: Allow uk citizens to view their progress of their tax rebate online
attributes.background: The amount of times my tax code has been changed incorrectly I've rang up to sort it out and later on rang again to check and there was no record of my previous call. In one occasion they debited my pay total in 2 months 800pound i would like it easier to some how log online to view the progress
attributes.additional_details: To be able to log online and check the status of a tax rebate  or if any money is due or owed I'm sure many other people feel the same way as to phone usually takes a minimum of 30 minutes on hold to get through. Once a women told me they didn't owe me anything I was debating it for 20 minutes and then she said oh yh I was looking at the wrong box. What would of happened if I said ok ??

attributes.action: Create Priority (BLUE) Routes for Disabled People, similar to Cycle Routes
attributes.background:
I have been a Mobility Scooter and driver for a number of years, however I now suffer from balance problems and have had my license withdrawn, so am even more reliant on my scooter.

I have found that using it is painful, tiring, dangerous, stressful and restricts my independence.
attributes.additional_details:
Not only are pavements bumpy, they have excessive cambers, even worse when crossing driveway accesses, and then there are the dropped kerbs at crossings. 
These have excessive slopes and cambers, tipping people toward the road and heavy traffic.
I was totally ignored by drivers several times, sworn and hooted at by others, particularly at blind corners.
Blue routes should be level, crossings safe perhaps controlled, warnings to drivers etc
We have cycle and red routes, lets have Blue Routes !!

attributes.action: NHS, Fire, and Police, pay no income tax if earning below the national average.
attributes.background: My partner is a newly qualified neonatal nurse caring for seriously ill babies and as an example earns less than our postman for the same hours.
attributes.additional_details: Paying income tax means that part of their salary goes back to the NHS that employs them.

attributes.action: Only allow reducted sentences for those prisoners who plead guilty immediately.
attributes.background: Prisoners have their sentence reduced by a third if they admit their guilt at the 'first opportunity'. In practice they receive this reduction even if they wait until court to plead guilty - wasting vast amounts of police time. This reduction should only be for those who admit guilt before charge.

attributes.action: Petition for Flower Of Scotland to be the national anthem of Scotland.
attributes.background:
"There is no official national anthem of Scotland."

The Flower of Scotland should be the national anthem of Scotland, representing this nation.

attributes.action: Limit the time MP's can talk during a debate to stop the practice Fillabustering
attributes.background: The practice of "fillabustering" is an unfair practice used by opposition members to waste time during a Private Members Bill debate and therefore delay or entirely prevent a vote on the proposal.  We demand that time for any one member to talk during a debate on a bill is limited.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-politics-18784131

attributes.action: Ex Pats should not be allowed to vote in the upcoming EU Referendum
attributes.background: Ex pats that have lived outside the UK for over 15 years should not be given a vote in the upcoming referendum. They have decided to live outside the UK and should not have a say in this important vote that affects those that live in the United Kingdom.
attributes.additional_details: With Ex Pats creating a future court case, the government is urged to not allow a vote from those living outside the UK for over 15 years. Such votes are likely to be biased and not a true reflection on those who reside in the United Kingdom.

attributes.action: Ban Barack Obama from UK for  remarks about the UK handling of  Libyan conflict.
attributes.background: Recent reports where American President Barack Obama has made derogatory remarks of the British and French governments involvement and poor performance in relation to the Libyan conflict.

attributes.action: Start to plan real strategy to deal with Donald Trump as President.
attributes.background: The USA could well be run by Donald Trump in 2017, he, his policies and his supporters are the biggest threat to democracy & world security in the 21st century. We must start planning for this possible outcome and distance ourselves from the United States of America.
attributes.additional_details:
Should Trump become President we should...

Stop buying US:
Weapons;
Goods;
Services; &
Oil (crude)

Remove:
US ran military bases in the UK and vote to remove them across the EU; &
Agreements to use UK airspace / airfields for US military (airforce, army, navy, et al)

Veto:
All US led UN war resolutions; &
All UN tabled resolutions that could result in an outbreak of war or invasion by the US or UN.

attributes.action: Investigate the standard of care provided by local CFS ME services in the uk.
attributes.background: Chronic fatigue syndrome (CFS) / myalgic encephalomyelitis (ME), is a debilitating disease that causes many symptoms including severe fatigue. The quality of care appears to be perticually poor in the uk, especially in rural counties, with some services acting outside of nice guidelines.
attributes.additional_details: My personal experience with my local CFS service has been extremely poor, I was 16 when diagnosed and until I was 18 I was seen 3 times be a children's OT. All that my local CFS service offers is an initial information session (the information was mostly wrong), an initial assessment and a 6 week managing life styles group, this is completely contradictory to the NICE guideline. And they do not offer CBT or GET, 2 of the 3 treatments recommended by NICE. This is not the only service like this!

attributes.action: Legalize Cannabis Oil and use it in the NHS to help people suffering from Cancer
attributes.background: Cannabis Oil itself is able to cure Cancer and there is enough evidence and research to prove so. if this was legalized and put into the NHS,the amount of patients suffering from cancer would decrease and would effectively save people from Cancer.
attributes.additional_details:
also, the reason that cannabis oil (from cannabis) is not used to cure and kill cancer because it is a plant, and cannot be patented, which means pharmaceutical companies cannot make profit off it.

http://www.mirror.co.uk/news/world-news/government-finally-admits-cannabis-kills-6303176

https://www.cancertutor.com/index8/

http://www.cureyourowncancer.org/how-cannabis-oil-works.html

attributes.action: Protect and support the Forest of Dean wildlife especially the wild boar.
attributes.background: The Forest of Dean is unique. It is home to a vast array of wildlife including boar. The health of the wildlife is watched over by  charitable organisations. Because of the nature of the forest it's not unusual for boar to roam in to areas populated by humans. This isn't taken to kindly.
attributes.additional_details: It is our belief that such wild animals will only breed to their environment and if left alone will not over breed. We would like a vast majority of the forest to be a safe zone for our wildlife. And we would like full support for the charities and education to residents in the forest that the flora, fauna and wildlife should be cherished as an I portent part of our heritage.

attributes.action: England, Wales and Northern Ireland to hold a referendum on Scotland leaving UK
attributes.background: For the past 300 years England has been held responsible for all the failures that has beset Scotland. A referendum was held and the people of Scotland decided to remain in the UK. I believe the concessions given to the people was unreasonable and very expensive for the rest of the UK.
attributes.additional_details:
I believe it has now become unfair that the rest of the UK is continually being asked to fit the bill in Scotland. 
It must be remembered that Scotland has free University education, free nursing home care for the elderly.
I do accept these are it would be good for all the UK to have these however, others accept these are affordable because of the subsidies Scotland receives. The latest request for half a billion pounds is the latest demand.

attributes.action: Amend The Equality Act 2010 to include lifestyle choices.
attributes.background:
Many companies in the UK are starting to use "anti-smoking policies" that they will not hire, and even terminate an employees contract for smoking, even if they smoke off the employers premises. 
I feel as if the government should update the equality act 2010 to include lifestyle choices.
attributes.additional_details:
Over in the USA, 30 States have made  similar legislations to protect workers personal life. 
If we amend the equality act 2010 to include lifestyle/personal life's of workers, this will include a lot of lifestyle choices, Anything from smoking to being vegan. It's ridiculous that some companies won't employ smokers. Why should a business go out of its way to not employ someone who smokes which is a personal choice, even if the employee agrees to smoke off premises?.
